Print This Page
Cambridge City
MA

Resolution
RES 2024 #187

Condolences on the Death of Patricia "Pat" Daley.

Information

Department:City Clerk's Office, PTSponsors:Councillor Paul F. Toner
Category:Death Resolution

Attachments

Version History
  1. Printout

Body

WHEREAS:

The City Council was deeply saddened at learning of the death of Patricia Daley on June 27, 2024, at the age of 85; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Patricia was the cherished daughter of the late Ivan and Gladys (Hart) Young; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Patricia was the devoted wife of 65 years to the late William E. Daley Jr.; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Patricia’s passing will leave a void in the lives of all her surviving family, including her children William III and his wife Marlene, Robert, Barbara and her partner John, Lorraine, Karen and her husband Salvatore, Susan Harris and her husband Marc, grandchildren William IV, Lauren, Sean, Jeffery, Taylor, Constant, Quentin, Derrick, Danielle, and Nicolas, great-grandchild Jesse and many nieces and nephews; also predeceased by her grandchild Scott and brother Daniel and his wife Millie; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Patricia, fondly known as Pat and often Pat Daley, served as the beloved Fitzgerald Community Schools Coordinator for 48 years until her retirement in 2017; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Patricia was a revered figure in the community, overseeing afterschool activities for elementary-aged students, organizing summer camps, preschool programs, adult programs, and senior events for the North Cambridge Community; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Patricia earned the respect and admiration of the community, particularly for her dedication to the young children and the teenagers she mentored, always expressing her love for her work and appreciation for the families she served; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Pat and Bill cherished their time together, enjoying years camping with their family in Vermont where they eventually purchased a home in Londonderry, which became a beloved retreat for their family; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

With a shared passion for travel, Pat and Bill explored over 35 countries across Asia, Africa, North America, South America, and Europe; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Patricia’s passing leaves an irreplaceable void in the hearts of all who were touched by her presence; now therefore be it

 

 

RESOLVED:

That this City Council go on record extending its deepest sympathy for the family of Patricia Daley at this time of such personal loss; and be it further

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Clerk be and hereby is requested to forward a suitably engrossed copy of this resolution to the Daley family on behalf of the entire City Council.
